name: dreaded
content:

causing fear or worry: As dawn breaks, another patrol heads out looking for the dreaded roadside bombs. Her husband came down with the dreaded polio in 1922.
humorous used to refer to something that you do not like or want: It’s time to fill out the dreaded tax forms. I need to check all the dreaded paperwork. See
